intro: Lepidium stylatum subsp. petrophilum, commonly known as the rock pepper or mountain pepper, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This subspecies is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compact, evergreen foliage that thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it forms dense mats or low shrubs. Lepidium stylatum subsp. petrophilum is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
